creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: young woman in pink kimono with elaborate hair ornament sitting on a cushion at bamboo table set with small bowls and chopsticks; holds green plate with round purple treat in PL hand, cuts into treat with small object in PR hand
marks: Margin: [一九五一年作　京のしるこ屋] {1951nen saku, ?????}; bot LRC: [遠志] {Tōshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: In a Kyoto Sweet Shop
